p: The viruses are infectious agents and mandatory cellular parasites. The viral particle is constituted of a genome [either ribonucleic acid (RNA) or deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA), simple or double stranded], bearer of the genetic information and a protein capsid ensuring its protection in the environment. In some cases the capsid may be surrounded by a second external layer, the envelope, which is lipido-protein ( Koopmans and Duizer, 2004).
